articles.description: Due to precipitation, Douglas Forest Protective Association will decrease Industrial Fire Precaution Levels to Level 2 and Public Use Restrictions to moderate for all associated lands in the Douglas District.
articles.title: DFPA decreases fire danger

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: DFPA will issue permits for prescribed pasture burns to improve grazing lands and reduce wildfire risk. Backyard debris burning remains closed. Learn more about prescribed fire: https://extension.oregonstate.edu/collection/prescribed-fire-basics
articles.title: DFPA to Issue Prescribed Pasture Burn Permits, Backyard Debris Burns Still Restricted

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Johnathan James Dowdy, 33, of Coos Bay, was sentenced to 20 years and six months in prison for the April 18 crash that killed UCC softball player Kiley Jones and head coach Jami Strinz, and injured teammates. Victims and families shared emotional statements during sentencing.
articles.title: Dowdy Sentenced to More Than 20 Years for Fatal Crash Involving UCC Softball Team

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Lookingglass Rural Fire District is seeking community letters of support for a $15,000 Ford Family Foundation grant to help buy a Zoll X-Series Cardiac Monitor. The device will cut costs, speed patient transfers, and improve emergency care as call volumes rise. Email captain@lookingglassfire.org
articles.title: Community Support Needed: Lookingglass Rural Fire District Seeks Grant for Lifesaving Cardiac Monitor

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: DINT seized 15 firearms, narcotics, cash, and suspected stolen property during a Monday raid on Wells Road in Oakland, Ore., court records say. Caleb Plueard, 42, and Erica Hewlett, 44, were arrested and charged; bail set at $70,000 and $15,000.
articles.title: DINT raid in Oakland yields firearms, narcotics, suspected stolen property

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: September 10, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg begins a water main replacement Sept. 17 on SE Pine St. between Oak & Sykes. Expect lane closures 7 p.m.–6 a.m. through Sept. 24, then daytime work starting Sept. 29. Project may pause in winter. Info: 541-492-6730 or pwd@roseburgor.gov
articles.title: Roseburg to Begin Water Main Replacement Project on SE Pine Street

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Winston-Dillard Melon Festival returns Sept. 19–21 at Riverbend Park! 🎉 Join us for food, crafts, kids’ fun, and the parade on Sept. 20 at 11 a.m. (registration 10 a.m.). Vendors welcome - no insurance needed except food, weapons, or activity booths!
articles.title: Winston-Dillard Melon Festival Marks 56 Sweet Years of Tradition

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: September 9, 2025 marks five years since the Archie Creek Fire swept through Douglas County, burning 131,500 acres and destroying over 100 homes. Recovery continues as Glide reflects on loss, rebuilding, and resilience in the face of one of Oregon’s most devastating wildfires.
articles.title: Five Years After the Flames: Archie Creek Fire’s Enduring Mark on Glide

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: DFPA has lowered fire danger levels following recent rain. Effective Sept. 9, IFPL drops to Level 2 and Public Use Restrictions to Moderate across the district. Industrial and public activities face time-of-day limits to reduce wildfire risk. Full details at www.dfpa.net
articles.title: DFPA Lowers Fire Precaution Levels Following Rainfall

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: The Douglas Forest Protective Association (DFPA) is set to issue permits for prescribed pasture burning as conditions allow.
articles.title: Fire safety boost: Prescribed burns return to Douglas County

articles.author: Chelsea Deffenbacher
articles.description: The driver involved in a tragic bus crash that claimed the lives of a softball coach and player has been sentenced to more than 20 years in prison.
articles.title: Coos Bay man gets 20 years for fatal drunk driving crash

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: The Douglas Forest Protective Association (DFPA) is actively responding to fires caused by recent lightning activity, forest officials said.
articles.title: Final mop-up underway for lightning-caused fires in Douglas County

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: Firefighters are responding to several lightning-induced fires across the Douglas Forest Protective Association district following a storm on Monday, DFPA officials said.
articles.title: More Douglas County fires sparked by lightning storms
